availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, 1863-1867

body.p: This is to certify that I T. N. Finnell was the agent for Scott County in the impressment of negroes on the public Works of the united states Government under Genl Fry.
I required all persons having negroes in their emply either hired or belonging to them, to give them in, taking from them the quota as directed in Genl Boyles order no 41.

Saml Smith delivered to me one negro belonging to Urias Offutt (He said Smith) having him hired) by the name of Thornton Williams as the one he was to furnish. And I delivered the said negro to camp nelson to Genl Fry.
